t: Psalm 119
Meditations and Prayers Relating to the Law of God.
Aleph.
How*pn blessed are those whose way is blameless, Who*ln walk in the law of the Lord.*s
How*ln blessed are those who observe His testimonies, Who*ln seek Him with all their*i heart.
They*ln also do no unrighteousness; They*ln walk in His ways.
You*ln have ordained Your precepts, That*ln we should keep them*i diligently.
Oh*ln that my ways may be established To*ln keep Your statutes!
Then*ln I shall not be ashamed When*ln I look upon all Your commandments.
I*ln shall give thanks to You with uprightness of heart, When*ln I learn Your righteous judgments.
I*ln shall keep Your statutes; Do*ln not forsake me utterly!
Beth.
How*pn can a young man keep his way pure? By*ln keeping it*i according to Your word.
With*ln all my heart I have sought You; Do*ln not let me wander from Your commandments.
Your*ln word I have treasured in my heart, That*ln I may not sin against You.
Blessed*ln are You, O Lord;*s Teach*ln me Your statutes.
With*ln my lips I have told of All*ln the ordinances of Your mouth.
I*ln have rejoiced in the way of Your testimonies, As*ln much as in all riches.
I*ln will meditate on Your precepts And*ln regard Your ways.
I*ln shall delight in Your statutes; I*ln shall not forget Your word.
Gimel.
Deal*pn bountifully with Your servant, That*ln I may live and keep Your word.
Open*ln my eyes, that I may behold Wonderful*ln things from Your law.
I*ln am a stranger in the earth; Do*ln not hide Your commandments from me.
My*ln soul is crushed with longing After*ln Your ordinances at all times.
You*ln rebuke the arrogant, the cursed, Who*ln wander from Your commandments.
Take*ln away reproach and contempt from me, For*ln I observe Your testimonies.
Even*ln though princes sit and*i talk against me, Your*ln servant meditates on Your statutes.
Your*ln testimonies also are my delight; They*iln are*i my counselors.
Daleth.
My*pn soul cleaves to the dust; Revive*ln me according to Your word.
I*ln have told of my ways, and You have answered me; Teach*ln me Your statutes.
Make*ln me understand the way of Your precepts, So*ln I will meditate on Your wonders.
My*ln soul weeps because of grief; Strengthen*ln me according to Your word.
Remove*ln the false way from me, And*ln graciously grant me Your law.
I*ln have chosen the faithful way; I*ln have placed Your ordinances before*i me.*i
I*ln cling to Your testimonies; O*ln Lord,*s do not put me to shame!
I*ln shall run the way of Your commandments, For*ln You will enlarge my heart.
He.
Teach*pn me, O Lord,*s the way of Your statutes, And*ln I shall observe it to the end.
Give*ln me understanding, that I may observe Your law And*ln keep it with all my*i heart.
Make*ln me walk in the path of Your commandments, For*ln I delight in it.
Incline*ln my heart to Your testimonies And*ln not to dishonest*i gain.
Turn*ln away my eyes from looking at vanity, And*ln revive me in Your ways.
Establish*ln Your word to Your servant, As*ln that which produces reverence for You.
Turn*ln away my reproach which I dread, For*ln Your ordinances are good.
Behold,*ln I long for Your precepts; Revive*ln me through Your righteousness.
Vav.
May*pn Your lovingkindnesses also come to me, O Lord,*s Your*ln salvation according to Your word;
So*ln I will have an answer for him who reproaches me, For*ln I trust in Your word.
And*ln do not take the word of truth utterly out of my mouth, For*ln I wait for Your ordinances.
So*ln I will keep Your law continually, Forever*ln and ever.
And*ln I will walk at liberty, For*ln I seek Your precepts.
I*ln will also speak of Your testimonies before kings And*ln shall not be ashamed.
I*ln shall delight in Your commandments, Which*ln I love.
And*ln I shall lift up my hands to Your commandments, Which*ln I love; And*ln I will meditate on Your statutes.
Zayin.
Remember*pn the word to Your servant, In*ln which You have made me hope.
This*ln is my comfort in my affliction, That*ln Your word has revived me.
The*ln arrogant utterly deride me, Yet*iln I do not turn aside from Your law.
I*ln have remembered Your ordinances from of old, O Lord,*s And*ln comfort myself.
Burning*ln indignation has seized me because of the wicked, Who*ln forsake Your law.
Your*ln statutes are my songs In*ln the house of my pilgrimage.
O*ln Lord,*s I remember Your name in the night, And*ln keep Your law.
This*ln has become mine, That*ln I observe Your precepts.
Heth.
The*pn Lord*s is my portion; I*ln have promised to keep Your words.
I*ln sought Your favor with all my*i heart; Be*ln gracious to me according to Your word.
I*ln considered my ways And*ln turned my feet to Your testimonies.
I*ln hastened and did not delay To*ln keep Your commandments.
The*ln cords of the wicked have encircled me, But*iln I have not forgotten Your law.
At*ln midnight I shall rise to give thanks to You Because*ln of Your righteous ordinances.
I*ln am a companion of all those who fear You, And*ln of those who keep Your precepts.
The*ln earth is full of Your lovingkindness, O Lord;*s Teach*ln me Your statutes.
Teth.
You*pn have dealt well with Your servant, O*ln Lord,*s according to Your word.
Teach*ln me good discernment and knowledge, For*ln I believe in Your commandments.
Before*ln I was afflicted I went astray, But*ln now I keep Your word.
You*ln are good and do good; Teach*ln me Your statutes.
The*ln arrogant have forged a lie against me; With*ln all my*i heart I will observe Your precepts.
Their*ln heart is covered with fat, But*iln I delight in Your law.
It*ln is good for me that I was afflicted, That*ln I may learn Your statutes.
The*ln law of Your mouth is better to me Than*ln thousands of gold and silver pieces.*i
Yodh.
Your*pn hands made me and fashioned me; Give*ln me understanding, that I may learn Your commandments.
May*ln those who fear You see me and be glad, Because*ln I wait for Your word.
I*ln know, O Lord,*s that Your judgments are righteous, And*ln that in faithfulness You have afflicted me.
O*ln may Your lovingkindness comfort me, According*ln to Your word to Your servant.
May*ln Your compassion come to me that I may live, For*ln Your law is my delight.
May*ln the arrogant be ashamed, for they subvert me with a lie; But*iln I shall meditate on Your precepts.
May*ln those who fear You turn to me, Even*ln those who know Your testimonies.
May*ln my heart be blameless in Your statutes, So*ln that I will not be ashamed.
Kaph.
My*pn soul languishes for Your salvation; I*ln wait for Your word.
My*ln eyes fail with*i longing*i for Your word, While*ln I say, “When will You comfort me?”
Though*ln I have become like a wineskin in the smoke, I*ln do not forget Your statutes.
How*ln many are the days of Your servant? When*ln will You execute judgment on those who persecute me?
The*ln arrogant have dug pits for me, Men*iln who are not in accord with Your law.
All*ln Your commandments are faithful; They*ln have persecuted me with a lie; help me!
They*ln almost destroyed me on earth, But*ln as for me, I did not forsake Your precepts.
Revive*ln me according to Your lovingkindness, So*ln that I may keep the testimony of Your mouth.
Lamedh.
Forever,*pn O Lord,*s Your*ln word is settled in heaven.
Your*ln faithfulness continues*i throughout all generations; You*ln established the earth, and it stands.
They*ln stand this day according to Your ordinances, For*ln all things are Your servants.
If*ln Your law had not been my delight, Then*ln I would have perished in my affliction.
I*ln will never forget Your precepts, For*ln by them You have revived me.
I*ln am Yours, save me; For*ln I have sought Your precepts.
The*ln wicked wait for me to destroy me; I*ln shall diligently consider Your testimonies.
I*ln have seen a limit to all perfection; Your*ln commandment is exceedingly broad.
Mem.
O*pn how I love Your law! It*ln is my meditation all the day.
Your*ln commandments make me wiser than my enemies, For*ln they are ever mine.
I*ln have more insight than all my teachers, For*ln Your testimonies are my meditation.
I*ln understand more than the aged, Because*ln I have observed Your precepts.
I*ln have restrained my feet from every evil way, That*ln I may keep Your word.
I*ln have not turned aside from Your ordinances, For*ln You Yourself have taught me.
How*ln sweet are Your words to my taste! Yes,*iln sweeter*i than honey to my mouth!
From*ln Your precepts I get understanding; Therefore*ln I hate every false way.
Nun.
Your*pn word is a lamp to my feet And*ln a light to my path.
I*ln have sworn and I will confirm it, That*ln I will keep Your righteous ordinances.
I*ln am exceedingly afflicted; Revive*ln me, O Lord,*s according to Your word.
O*ln accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Lord,*s And*ln teach me Your ordinances.
My*ln life is continually in my hand, Yet*ln I do not forget Your law.
The*ln wicked have laid a snare for me, Yet*ln I have not gone astray from Your precepts.
I*ln have inherited Your testimonies forever, For*ln they are the joy of my heart.
I*ln have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes Forever,*ln even*i to the end.
Samekh.
I*pn hate those who are double-minded, But*ln I love Your law.
You*ln are my hiding place and my shield; I*ln wait for Your word.
Depart*ln from me, evildoers, That*ln I may observe the commandments of my God.
Sustain*ln me according to Your word, that I may live; And*ln do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
Uphold*ln me that I may be safe, That*ln I may have regard for Your statutes continually.
You*ln have rejected all those who wander from Your statutes, For*ln their deceitfulness is useless.
You*ln have removed all the wicked of the earth like*i dross; Therefore*ln I love Your testimonies.
My*ln flesh trembles for fear of You, And*ln I am afraid of Your judgments.
Ayin.
I*pn have done justice and righteousness; Do*ln not leave me to my oppressors.
Be*ln surety for Your servant for good; Do*ln not let the arrogant oppress me.
My*ln eyes fail with*i longing*i for Your salvation And*ln for Your righteous word.
Deal*ln with Your servant according to Your lovingkindness And*ln teach me Your statutes.
I*ln am Your servant; give me understanding, That*ln I may know Your testimonies.
It*ln is time for the Lord*s to act, For*iln they have broken Your law.
Therefore*ln I love Your commandments Above*ln gold, yes, above fine gold.
Therefore*ln I esteem right all Your*i precepts concerning everything, I*ln hate every false way.
Pe.
Your*pn testimonies are wonderful; Therefore*ln my soul observes them.
The*ln unfolding of Your words gives light; It*ln gives understanding to the simple.
I*ln opened my mouth wide and panted, For*ln I longed for Your commandments.
Turn*ln to me and be gracious to me, After*ln Your manner with those who love Your name.
Establish*ln my footsteps in Your word, And*ln do not let any iniquity have dominion over me.
Redeem*ln me from the oppression of man, That*ln I may keep Your precepts.
Make*ln Your face shine upon Your servant, And*ln teach me Your statutes.
My*ln eyes shed streams of water, Because*ln they do not keep Your law.
Tsadhe.
Righteous*pn are You, O Lord,*s And*ln upright are Your judgments.
You*ln have commanded Your testimonies in righteousness And*ln exceeding faithfulness.
My*ln zeal has consumed me, Because*ln my adversaries have forgotten Your words.
Your*ln word is very pure, Therefore*ln Your servant loves it.
I*ln am small and despised, Yet*iln I do not forget Your precepts.
Your*ln righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, And*ln Your law is truth.
Trouble*ln and anguish have come upon me, Yet*iln Your commandments are my delight.
Your*ln testimonies are righteous forever; Give*ln me understanding that I may live.
Qoph.
I*pn cried with all my heart; answer me, O Lord!*s I*ln will observe Your statutes.
I*ln cried to You; save me And*ln I shall keep Your testimonies.
I*ln rise before dawn and cry for help; I*ln wait for Your words.
My*ln eyes anticipate the night watches, That*ln I may meditate on Your word.
Hear*ln my voice according to Your lovingkindness; Revive*ln me, O Lord,*s according to Your ordinances.
Those*ln who follow after wickedness draw near; They*ln are far from Your law.
You*ln are near, O Lord,*s And*ln all Your commandments are truth.
Of*ln old I have known from Your testimonies That*ln You have founded them forever.
Resh.
Look*pn upon my affliction and rescue me, For*ln I do not forget Your law.
Plead*ln my cause and redeem me; Revive*ln me according to Your word.
Salvation*ln is far from the wicked, For*ln they do not seek Your statutes.
Great*ln are Your mercies, O Lord;*s Revive*ln me according to Your ordinances.
Many*ln are my persecutors and my adversaries, Yet*iln I do not turn aside from Your testimonies.
I*ln behold the treacherous and loathe them,*i Because*ln they do not keep Your word.
Consider*ln how I love Your precepts; Revive*ln me, O Lord,*s according to Your lovingkindness.
The*ln sum of Your word is truth, And*ln every one of Your righteous ordinances is everlasting.
Shin.
Princes*pn persecute me without cause, But*ln my heart stands in awe of Your words.
I*ln rejoice at Your word, As*ln one who finds great spoil.
I*ln hate and despise falsehood, But*iln I love Your law.
Seven*ln times a day I praise You, Because*ln of Your righteous ordinances.
Those*ln who love Your law have great peace, And*ln nothing causes them to stumble.
I*ln hope for Your salvation, O Lord,*s And*ln do Your commandments.
My*ln soul keeps Your testimonies, And*ln I love them exceedingly.
I*ln keep Your precepts and Your testimonies, For*ln all my ways are before You.
Tav.
Let*pn my cry come before You, O Lord;*s Give*ln me understanding according to Your word.
Let*ln my supplication come before You; Deliver*ln me according to Your word.
Let*ln my lips utter praise, For*ln You teach me Your statutes.
Let*ln my tongue sing of Your word, For*ln all Your commandments are righteousness.
Let*ln Your hand be ready to help me, For*ln I have chosen Your precepts.
I*ln long for Your salvation, O Lord,*s And*ln Your law is my delight.
Let*ln my soul live that it may praise You, And*ln let Your ordinances help me.
I*ln have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek Your servant, For*ln I do not forget Your commandments.
